main event: A man reported seeing a bright silver disc hovering in the sky near Fogelsville, Pennsylvania on August 6, 1957.
interesting points: The disc was estimated to be 20 to 40 feet in diameter and 30 to 40 feet thick., The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes., The report concluded that the object could possibly be a balloon, missile, aircraft, or astronomical., The witness had experience as a radar supervisor during the war., The report lacked sufficient data for a definitive conclusion.
witness description: a man with radar supervisor experience
